newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat closes lower on Great Plains rains.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat closes lower on Great Plains rains.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures closed lower on showers overnight in key dry areas of Kansas and Nebraska wheat growing regions, traders said.
"That's the overriding influence here, the rains," a trader said.
Traders said the July contract, while closing sharply lower, was showing signs of stabilizing near the close.
"We filled the gap from $4.01 to $3.98 and bounced a little on the close," a trader said.
The chart gap was set in April.
The charts showed the three cent gap was set on April 10 and the $4.00 area is now seen as an important support level, traders said.
KCBT hard red winter wheat futures closed three to 6-1/2 cents per bushel lower, with July down 6-1/2 at $4.00-1/2.
Volume was estimated by the KCBT at 47.415 million bushels, above the 36.505 million traded Thursday.
